mention.text: Kosovo , one of the most important crossroads
The Battle of Kosovo , also known as the Battle of Kosovo Field or the Battle of Blackbird 's Field
the army led by Serbian Prince Lazar Hrebeljanović
the invading army of the Ottoman Empire under the leadership of Sultan Murad I
Prince Lazar , ruler of Moravian Serbia , aware of the Ottoman threat
ruler of Moravian Serbia , aware of the Ottoman threat
Moravian Serbia , aware of the Ottoman threat
Murad , surrounded by his cavalry guard
The bulk of both armies was wiped out in the battle ; both Lazar and Murad
The Ottomans , in a ferocious counter-attack led by Bayezid
the Serbian principalities that were not already Ottoman vassals , one after the other
the Serbian principalities that were not already Ottoman vassals , one after the other
Ottoman vassals , one after the other
Ottoman vassals , one after the other
Emperor Stefan Uroš IV Dušan the Mighty -LRB- r. 1331-1355 -RRB-
his son Stefan Uroš V -LRB- r. 1355-1371 -RRB- whose reign was characterized by decline of central power and rise of numerous virtually independent principalities
Murad I , the reigning Ottoman sultan
whereupon he moved across Prokuplje to Kosovo
the alternative route through Sofia and the Nišava Valley
the best place Lazar could choose as a battlefield , as it gave him control of all the routes that Murad could take
his sons Bayezid on his right and Yakub
a letter from the Florentine senate to King Tvrtko I of Bosnia dated 20 October 1389
